description: Here's an example of how to extend Pury, a runtime profiler for Android apps.
title: Get access to raw profiling results with plugins for Pury

description: Here's an interesting approach to multi-selection on mobile. It includes code samples and a GitHub project.
title: Building a Multiselection Solution for Android in Kotlin

description: In this post by Halyna Halkina you'll learn about the options on how to play audio right.
title: Audio (not) playing in Android

description: Here are some examples of how to make your app more testable using Dagger dependency injection.
title: Providing test doubles with Dagger 1 and Dagger 2

description: Mark Allison takes a look into a new ConstraintLayout feature that was recently added: chains.
title: ConstraintLayout Chains – Part 1

description: Moyinoluwa Adeyemi continues the series with the Barcode Detection API.
title: Machine Learning with the Mobile Vision API — Part 2

description: Rx is not unicorns and rainbows. In this post, Tomek Polański shares some frustrations while using RxJava and show that despite some bumps along the way, it is an awesome tool.
title: Reactive Frustrations

description: The SOLID principles are fundamental to explaining a part of what clean code is, but sometimes explaining what SOLID means is a task in itself. This blog posts shows how we tried to re-examine SOLID visually to help all our developers embrace and learn from SOLID design.
title: Designing something S.O.L.I.D

description: SwiftKey uses the Zendesk Mobile SDK to deliver in-app support to more than 250 million users. Embed support in-app to have extra context about users and nip issues in the bud to boost app store ratings. Read the SwiftKey story.
title: How SwiftKey uses Zendesk to support 250m users

description: Get 5+ Job Offers in 1 Week! Use Hired to get Android job offers from top companies.
title: Get Your New Job Faster with Hired

description: Enhance your app with a photo editor with plenty of features and styles. The SDK is fully customizable - within minutes.
title: Photo Editor SDK

description: Material Design’s new suite of tools and open source projects help make product design more productive and inspiring.
title: Design Is Never Done

description: Netflix is the leading video streaming service globally and the Netflix Android application is one of the most widely used mobile applications. We work hard to constantly improve the performance, features, and quality of the app as we expand our coverage to every country in the world.
title: Senior Software Engineer - Android

description: Join one of our Android teams and take on responsibility for the constant creation of mobile moments. You will be part of a cross-functional team consisting of Development, Product and Project Management, Interaction/Visual Design and Quality Assurance. Become the newest member of our team!
title: Senior Android Developer (m/f)

description: Come build the future of money at Circle. We are a fun, easy, and free way to send money to friends. We're rapidly expanding globally and we want you to help us build and improve our Google award-winning Android app.
title: Senior Android Developer

description: Yelp connects consumers with great local businesses. We’re looking for Android developers who love creating delightful, compelling experiences for millions of people and thrive in taking ownership of the product they work on. We're building new products and investing in our Android infrastructure.
title: Android Engineer

description: A powerful Model-View-Presenter framework for android
title: EasyMVP

description: Input mask is a little form helper that helps you to put your input in shape. It's great for formatting phone or credit card numbers since you can easily specify the input mask.
title: Input Mask

description: A script which synchronizes all of the artifacts in your local Android SDK to a remote Maven artifact host.
title: sdk-artifact-sync

description: A set of cross-platform libraries and protocols to allow the sharing of design values and live refinement of apps during the development process. Remixer helps teams use and refine design specs by providing an abstraction for these values that is accessible and configurable from both inside and outside the app itself.
title: material-remixer

description: Google has published ConstraintLayout beta 2. This build fixes a few issues with API level support under level 16. It also contains several large performance improvements (~2x speedup in many common situations).
title: ConstraintLayout beta 2 is now available

description: Highlights from the Google Play services 9.8 release.
title: Google Play Services Release Notes

description: Google's Firebase team has made some new updates to the Firebase libraries for Android, iOS, as well as the Javascript SDK.
title: Some new Firebase libraries

description: Presentations from GOTO Copenhagen 2016, including Israel Ferrer Camacho, Pierre-Yves Ricau, Jake Wharton, Dan Lew and Ty Smith.
title: GOTO Copenhagen 2016

description: Margaret Maynard provides an overview of how you can integrate advanced machine learning algorithms with your Android apps, with several examples to help you get started making Android apps with human intelligence.
title: Machine Learning is Everywhere: Android Apps with Intelligence

description: Modern Android applications tend to be very modular, learn how an Event Bus can help keep your components decoupled.
title: EventBus Basics

description: The team talks with Android UI magician Israel. In this episode. He talks about tricks you can use in your Android apps to create a super slick UI, citing examples from Google Photos, Twitter and other apps.
title: Smoke and Mirror Android UI tricks with Israel

description: The age old question: should I be using an event bus today? What is an event bus? Donn and Kaushik have at it and try to answer this question that gets asked constantly in the AndroidDev circles.
title: The state of event bus(es) today

description: Sam Edwards tells us about how he uses the robot pattern to bring his QA team to Espresso testing, and how he takes screenshots automatically for debugging and UI verification
title: Android Dialogs: Sam Edwards

title: droidcon London 2016 Videos
